subject: Re: [junit] writing testcase for data read from a file
msgSnippet: So said  Singh Manpreet  on  2002-09-27 ... You re welcome. Please just remember that global data is generally bad and when you try to refactor it out, the
messageBody:
So said Singh Manpreet on 2002-09-27

>Dear Rainsberger,
>
>Thank you so very much for an excellent clarification.
>
You're welcome. Please just remember that global data is generally bad
and when you try to refactor it out, the result is usually good. It
doesn't matter what kind of global data you're dealing with...

Good luck.

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
